name: tomato production, fresh grade, open field | tomato, fresh grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20557/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Tomato during May-December, 2016 at a farm located in village Vadner Bhairav, District Nashik of Maharashtra State in India. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 70,000 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 15-July, 2016 and harvesting date is 20-December, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 66.91-261.23-108.04 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 40,000 kg of manure from cattle dung. Fungicide used has active ingredient as Carbendazim 731.25g/ha, Difenoconazole 56.25g/ha, Dimethomorph 750g/ha, Mancozeb 831g/ha, Metalaxil 20.8g/ha, Copper oxichloride 1500g/ha (Copper (Cu) used as proxy). Insecticide used has active ingredient as Abamectin 31.25g/ha, Chlorantranilipore 60g/ha (Clothianidin used as proxy), Cyantraniliprole 90g/ha (Thiamethoxam used as proxy), and Imidacloprid 36.49g/ha. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 12.48 kg/ha using plough, hoeing, earthen up and rotary cultivator for soil tillage. For plant protection machinery are used which consumes fuel 15.6kg/ha.   ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - tomato production, fresh grade, IN-MH, 2015 - 2018 (5cbcfa65-5f35-4661-8348-3aa25d7f7ea3)]

This activity starts about four weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in May and sowing of seeds started about five weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 5 months.


The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Tomato from the Tomato plant. Thereafter the field is prepared for cultivation of the next crop.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 04-May, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 20-December, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 155 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Tomato follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'tomato, fresh grade' is calculated to be circa 1.34E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'dolomite', 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.69E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
